title: Unhelpful error message for unsupported/tier-3 platforms when using no_std

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=576f0120ca20fddb1eaed15e45b2dede

```rust
#![feature(lang_items)]
#![no_std]
#![no_main]
use core::panic::PanicInfo;

#[lang = "eh_personality"]
extern "C" fn eh_personality() {}

#[panic_handler]
fn panic(_info: &PanicInfo) -> ! {
    loop {}
}
```

Compiled with: `cargo +nightly build --target armv6k-nintendo-3ds`

The current output is:

```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note: the `armv6k-nintendo-3ds` target may not be installed
  = help: consider downloading the target with `rustup target add armv6k-nintendo-3ds`
  = help: consider building the standard library from source with `cargo build -Zbuild-std`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note: the `armv6k-nintendo-3ds` target may not be installed
  = help: consider downloading the target with `rustup target add armv6k-nintendo-3ds`
  = help: consider building libcore from source with `cargo build -Zbuild-std=core`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

The problem is that `-Zbuild-std` will try to build `std`. This is the default suggestion when building something that lacks `#![no_std]` when using nightly. However, when using a `no_std` build, the error does not match, and diagnosing the issue becomes a bit of a roadblock, and somewhat challenging at times. As a result, the final help hint should recommend building `libcore` with `-Zbuild-std=core` instead when this kind of build is expected.

Note, building this with the correct flag will still throw up an error about lacking a spec file in a clean environment (3dsx.specs) - this is fine, and not a bug of rustc/cargo, and is also not required to reproduce the issue. It is also not exclusive to the `armv6k-nintendo-3ds` target, but it was a useful one to use here - pick any tier 3 target that lacks `libstd` support.
